event.title: lived in this region to the south and east of the Grampians for over 4,000 years

data.event: The Chapwurrung people lived in this region to the south and east of the Grampians for over 4,000 years prior to the arrival of the Europeans.

event.title: took up properties here in the late 1830s, and there was a decade

data.event: The first pastoralists took up properties here in the late 1830s, and there was a decade of sometimes violent clashes with the Chapwurring.

A Post Office of that name opened on 1 July 1852 (Dunkeld from 1 January 1854); but, as the early settlers were predominantly Scottish, it was renamed Dunkeld after a Scottish town which was the principal locality of the Caledonian picts in Roman times.

event.title: 1 January 1854); but, as the early settlers were predominantly Scottish, it was renamed

data.event: A Post Office of that name opened on 1 July 1852 (Dunkeld from 1 January 1854); but, as the early settlers were predominantly Scottish, it was renamed Dunkeld after a Scottish town which was the principal locality of the Caledonian picts in Roman times.
The Robertson's Woolpack Inn was the first building to be erected in 1845, followed by five other hotels - the Shamrock and the Western, the Royal Mail, the Collins Railway Hotel and the Family Inn.

event.title: declined with the opening of the railway (1877

data.event: Road traffic declined with the opening of the railway (1877 to Hamilton and Ararat, with another short lived line going south to Penshurst).
